intro: Acmella hirta, commonly known as the hairy spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant features small, yellow flowers surrounded by green bracts, and its leaves are hairy, giving it its common name. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats. Acmella hirta is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
